snippet: After President Aleksandr Lukashenko of Belarus rejected criticism of his authoritarian rule from Germany's gay foreign minister by saying it was "better to be a dictator than gay," the German government fired back.
abstract: After President Aleksandr Lukashenko of Belarus rejected criticism of his authoritarian rule from Germany's gay foreign minister by saying it was "better to be a dictator than gay," the German government fired back.

headline.main: Germany Not Amused by Belarus Leader's 'Better a Dictator Than Gay' Jibe
